title: 8 Best Day Spas in Mumbai to Relax and Rejuvenate
text:
By Sharell Cook Updated April 14, 2016 . 
Whether you'd like an Ayurvedic massage, aromatherapy, or facial and body treatment, there are some excellent luxury spas in Mumbai to cater for all your needs. Many also have private suites for couples, so you can enjoy relaxing with your loved one. The spas in this article are all located outside the city's five star hotels. If you are looking for a luxury hotel spa, the Oberoi in Nariman Point (south Mumbai), the JW Marriott on Juhu beach , the Four Seasons in Worli, and the St. Regis in Lower Parel (central Mumbai) are recommended. The Palms Spa 1. The Palms Spa, Colaba 
Small but soothing, and with impressive attention to detail, The Palms Spa is a relatively new entrant to the market. Its Colaba location is very convenient for worn out tourists, who feel in need of some pampering and rejuvenation. The menu features several classics including herbal detox massages, classic Thai massage, Balinese massage, and deep tissue sports massages, as well as innovative treatments and therapies. Masseuses are from Thailand. Top quality brands imported from Thailand, France and the UK are used. Address: Ground Floor, Dhanraj Mahal , Apollo Bunder, Opposite The Yacht Club (near the Gateway of India), Colaba. Phone: +91 (22) 6634-9898/9922. Opening Hours: 9 a.m. to 10.30 p.m. daily. Cost: Massage prices start from 1,200 rupees for a 30 minute reflexology foot massage. Expect to pay 3,200 to 3,700 rupees for a 60 minute massage. 90 minute massages are also available from 4,800 rupees upwards. What's Good: The Jet Lag package, which is a combination of body scrub, full body, and foot massage for 5,500 rupees. Personally, I prefer the Deep Tissue Sports Massage. The Balinese and Thai massages are popular. 
continue reading below our video America's Best Foodie Cities 2. Tahaa Spa, Nepean Sea Road 
Tahaa Spa is a tiny three room establishment that offers a range of treatments including manicures, pedicures, and massages. Don't let the small size of Tahaa Spa put you off, it's tastefully decorated inside, comes highly recommended, and has some of the best therapists in Mumbai. The emphasis at Tahaa is on technique, aimed at addressing problem areas. Make sure you book in advance. Address: 69-A Manisha Building, Nepean Sea Road, near near Malabar Hill. Phone: +91 (22) 2368-1001. Opening Hours: 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. Cost: Expect to pay 500 to 1,000 rupees for Express treatments. Other treatments range from about 1,000 rupees to 3,000 rupees. What's Good: Therapeutic Deep Tissue massage. Personalized aromatherapy massage.
